intro: Passiflora exsudans, commonly known as the exuding passionflower, is a tropical vine native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, complex flowers that feature a unique blend of colors and structures, including a crown of filaments and a central corona. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and climbing. Passiflora exsudans thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
